user_profile.about_text: I am Krishna Verma, a Computer Science undergraduate specializing in Backend Development and System Architecture. My journey began with the low-level logic of C++ and evolved into building scalable, high-performance web applications with Python & Flask. I bridge the gap between abstract algorithms and real-world utility, deeply focused on Game Logic and automated system optimization.

projects.title: Python ATM Simulation
projects.description: A robust console application simulating core banking functionalities, including secure PIN verification, balance inquiries, and transaction history.
projects.content: Developed during a Let'sUpgrade bootcamp, this project masters Python's control flow and Object-Oriented Programming. It implements secure PIN handling, session management, and state persistence for banking transactions.

projects.title: Live Weather Dashboard
projects.description: An advanced real-time weather tracking application featuring geolocation detection, 5-day forecasting, and dynamic themes adapting to live conditions.
projects.content:
A production-ready weather application that goes beyond simple API fetching.

The Challenge

Handling asynchronous data streams from the OpenWeatherMap API while ensuring the UI remains responsive. I implemented async/await patterns in vanilla JavaScript to handle these fetch requests gracefully.

Key Features

  • Geolocation API: Automatically detects user location on load.
  • Dynamic Backgrounds: The app changes visual themes based on weather conditions (Rainy, Sunny, Cloudy).
  • Error Handling: Robust fallback UI for 404 errors or failed API keys.

projects.title: Quote Studio AI
projects.description: A modern quote generator leveraging AI to create mood-based content with instant image export capabilities.
projects.content:
Quote Studio bridges the gap between text and visuals. By using AI, it generates quotes based on the user's current mood.

Architecture

The backend is built with Python, serving as a proxy to the AI model. The frontend allows users to export these quotes as downloadable aesthetic images, ready for social media.

projects.title: Dual Clock
projects.description: A precise time-keeping tool displaying synchronized digital and analog formats using Python's GUI capabilities.
projects.content: A Python GUI project exploring the Tkinter library. It renders a real-time analog clock face using trigonometry to calculate hand positions while maintaining perfect synchronization with the digital display.

projects.title: 2D Table Tennis
projects.description: A classic Ping Pong game implementation featuring score tracking, collision physics, and smooth 60 FPS rendering.
projects.content: Game development fundamentals. This project implements AABB collision detection and a custom game loop to render smooth gameplay, managing state updates and rendering cycles manually.

projects.title: Console Quiz System
projects.description: A modular C++ quiz engine featuring multiple-choice logic, file-based question banks, and automated scoring.
projects.content: A demonstration of Object-Oriented Programming in C++. The system uses classes to rigorously separate the Question Bank, User Session, and Scoring Logic, ensuring the code is maintainable and scalable.

projects.title: Student Grading System
projects.description: A record management system using binary file handling to Add, Search, and Save student data efficiently.
projects.content: This project replaces manual registers with a binary file database. It allows for high-speed CRUD operations on student records directly from the C console, demonstrating proficiency in pointer arithmetic and file streams.

blog_posts.title: Automating Academics: The Grading System
blog_posts.summary: My first foray into data persistence. A C-based tool to automate GPA calculations and student record management using low-level file handling.
blog_posts.content:
Why calculate grades manually when a loop can do it for you? This project was born out of a refusal to do repetitive math.

The Architecture

Built entirely in C, this system uses structs to define student data and effectively manages memory to store records. The biggest challenge wasn't the math—it was the file handling. Implementing fwrite and fread operations allowed me to create a persistent database without actually using SQL.

Key Takeaway

It taught me that data is just bytes. Whether it's a text file or a complex database, the principle remains the same: structure your data correctly, and retrieval becomes instant.

blog_posts.title: Console UX: Modular Quiz Engine
blog_posts.summary: A C++ console application that separates game logic from data. It demonstrates control flow, input validation, and the illusion of choice.
blog_posts.content:
A console window doesn't have to be boring. This project focuses on the user experience within a text-based environment.

Modular Design

Spaghetti code is the enemy. I designed this quiz engine to be modular. The 'Question Bank' is separated from the 'Scoring Logic'. This means adding a new question doesn't require rewriting the main loop.

The Logic

Using complex switch-case structures and input validation loops, the system ensures the game never crashes, even if the user tries to break it. It's a lesson in defensive programming.

blog_posts.title: Physics in a Loop: 2D Table Tennis
blog_posts.summary: Moving from static code to event-driven simulations. This project implements basic vector physics and collision detection in a real-time loop.
blog_posts.content:
Static code waits for input. Game code never sleeps. This Table Tennis simulation was my introduction to the Game Loop.

Collision Detection

The core of this project is geometry. Calculating the intersection of the ball (a circle) and the paddle (a rectangle) requires constant checking. If ball.x > width, we reverse the velocity vector. Simple math, creating complex behavior.

Event Management

Handling user input (paddle movement) while simultaneously rendering frame-by-frame physics taught me the importance of optimization. You only have 16ms to render a frame; efficient code is mandatory.

blog_posts.title: Mastering Time: Digital Clock App
blog_posts.summary: A study in asynchronous UI updates. Creating a digital clock requires precise management of the main thread to ensure zero-latency visuals.
blog_posts.content:
Time is the one variable you can't control, only measure. This application visualizes system time with custom aesthetics.

The Main Thread Problem

If you put a sleep() command in your UI thread, the whole app freezes. This project required separating the time-fetching logic from the UI-rendering logic. It ensures the window remains responsive (movable, closable) while the digits update every second.

blog_posts.title: Fetching the Sky: Weather Dashboard
blog_posts.summary: Connecting the local machine to the global grid. This dashboard consumes REST APIs to visualize real-time meteorological data.
blog_posts.content:
My local computer knows nothing about the sky outside. This project bridges that gap using APIs.

JSON Parsing

The challenge here isn't displaying text; it's parsing the massive JSON response from the weather provider. Extracting specific data points (Temperature, Humidity, Wind Speed) and mapping them to dynamic DOM elements is the cornerstone of modern web development.

Dynamic Visualization

Instead of just showing numbers, I used the data to render curves and graphs, making the data human-readable at a glance.

blog_posts.title: Quote Studio: AI Meets Minimalism
blog_posts.summary: The culmination of the journey. A full-stack web application combining AI-generated content with a polished, dark-mode aesthetic.
blog_posts.content:
The ultimate Lazy Coder project: I built an app that writes its own content.

The Stack

This project integrates a robust backend (to handle API requests to AI models) with a sleek, minimalist frontend. The design philosophy is 'Content First'.

AI Integration

By hooking into Generative AI APIs, the app generates unique quotes based on 'Mood' parameters. It proves that backend complexity can be hidden behind a simple, beautiful button.
